com.kaiserware.sailingrace

Class NavigationTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kaiserware.sailingrace.NavigationTools

  • public class NavigationTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper Class which various navigation tools / calculation. All angles are assumed to be True North for all calculations. For display purposes this program uses Magnetic North figures. Conversion between True and Magnetic North is based on the declination figure provided by the GPS class. Created by Volker Petersen November 2015.

      • TrueToMagnetic

        public static double TrueToMagnetic(double trueAngle,
                                    double declination)
        Method to convert a True North Compass reading into a Magnetic North compass reading Magnetic Bearing + Magnetic Declination = True Bearing MB = TB - MD
        Parameters:

        declination - Declination at the current location
        Returns:
        Magnetic North compass angle 0 to 359.999

      • calc_AVG_StdDev

        public static boolean calc_AVG_StdDev(double twd)
        Method to compute the short and long average value and Std Dev of all the values in the LinkedList TWD of length 'longQueue'. We use the previous TWD_longAVG for the calculation of the Std Dev. Test implementation in Excel 'SailingRace_Math' Tab 'Avg_Wind_Direction' and 'StdDev'
        Parameters:
        twd - - latest TWD reading
        Returns:
        flag - true if the twd is within +/- 3.0*StdDev (99% of all observations), false otherwise

      • LineIntersection

        public static double[] LineIntersection(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng Boat,
                                        com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng Committee,
                                        com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng Pin,
                                        double cog,
                                        double sog)
        Method to compute the intersection of the current course with the starting line. The starting line is defined as the line between the Committee Boat and Pin locations. Our boat is at location "Boat" traveling with Course "cog" and Speed "sog". With the given intersection and speed the method than computes and returns the Time to Line at the current course/speed (in seconds). It returns NaN if there is no line intersection found. see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/563198/how-do-you-detect-where-two-line-segments-intersect
        Parameters:
        Boat - LatLng of the race boat
        Committee - LatLng of the Committe boat end of the start line
        Pin - LatLng of the Pin end of the start line
        cog - heading of the boat
        sog - speed of the boat
        Returns:
        array a with distance, time (sec), lat, lon to/of intersection or NaN if the two line (course of the boat and start line) don't intersect

      • favoredPin

        public static double favoredPin(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng committee,
                                com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng pin,
                                double twd)
        Method to compute the favored Pin of the starting line based on the current wind.
        Parameters:
        committee - LatLng of the committee boat end of the startline
        pin - LatLng of the Pin end of the startline
        twd - current True Wind Direction in Degrees True North.
        Returns:
        double degrees favored (positive Committee, negative Pin)

      • favoredPinString

        public static java.lang.String favoredPinString(double favored)

      • calcVMG

        public static double calcVMG(double btm,
                             double sog)
        Method to compute the Velocity Made Good (VMG) toward the current active mark.
        Parameters:
        btm - Bearing-To-Mark (in Degrees True North)
        sog - Speed-Over-Ground (in kts)
        Returns:
        double vmg (in kts)

      • calcVMGu

        public static double calcVMGu(double twa,
                              double CourseOffset,
                              double sog)
        Method to compute the Velocity Made Good Upwind (VMGu) toward the current active mark. This is the preferred VMG calc since it measures your upwind progress and avoids the disadvantage of the conventional VMG that declines as you approach the mark layline. (because the angle to the mark approaches 90 as you approach the layline, at which point vmg=0).
        Parameters:
        twa - True Wind Angle (True North)
        CourseOffset - 0.0 for Upwind legs, 180.0 for Downwind legs
        sog - Speed-Over-Ground (in kts)
        Returns:
        vmgu = (sog * cos(twa) (in kts)

      • optimumLaylines

        public static double[] optimumLaylines(double boatLat,
                                       double boatLon,
                                       double markerLat,
                                       double markerLon,
                                       double TWD,
                                       double CourseOffset,
                                       double TackAngle,
                                       java.lang.String tack)
        Method to compute the optimum Laylines from current boat location to a mark returns the waypoint at which to tack to sail the course Boat->Tack->Mark. check drawing in Evernote "SailingRace App - Android" - angle BTM renamed to Stbd
        Parameters:
        boatLat -
        boatLon -
        markerLat -
        markerLon -
        TWD - True Wind Direction (True North)
        CourseOffset - 0.0 (Upwind course), 180.0 (Downwind course)
        TackAngle - optimum Upwind / Downwind Tack or Gybe angle
        tack - current tack (stbd or port)
        Returns:
        double[] array with [Latitude, Longitude, initial tack (0=stbd) (1=port), Distance, Heading] [ 0 1 2 3 4 ]

        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        results

      • calc_TWA_TWD_TWS

        public static double[] calc_TWA_TWD_TWS(double SOG,
                                        double AWA,
                                        double AWD,
                                        double AWS)
        Method to compute the True Wind Direction from the AWD and the SOG. See the Evernote Sailing note for the various angle definitions and Wikipedia https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apparent_wind Sample implementation in Excel in folder "VariousAppDevelopmentAssets".
        Parameters:
        SOG - Speed over Ground in Kts
        AWA - Apparent Wind Angle (in Degrees True North) = AWD - COG
        AWD - Apparent Wind Direction from the Windex Anemometer (in Degrees True North)
        AWS - Apparent Wind Speed from the Windex Anemometer (in kts)
        Returns:
        [TWA, TWD, TWS] (True Wind Angle and Direction in degrees True North and True Wind Speed in kts)

      • MarkDistanceBearing

        public static double[] MarkDistanceBearing(double latFrom,
                                           double lonFrom,
                                           double latTo,
                                           double lonTo)
        Method to compute Distance (in nm) and Bearing (in degrees True North) from the lat/lon FROM to the lat/lon TO using the Great Circle calculation (distance) and Rhumb line formula (heading).
        Parameters:
        latFrom -
        lonFrom -
        latTo -
        lonTo -
        Returns:
        double[] array with [Distance (nm), Bearing (True North)] from location FROM to location TO

        public static double[] withDistanceBearingToPosition(double latFrom,
                                                     double lonFrom,
                                                     double distance,
                                                     double bearing)
        Method to compute the latitude and longitude when moving a set Distance (in nm) and Bearing (in degrees) from a given location (latFrom, lonFrom)
        Parameters:
        latFrom -
        lonFrom -
        distance - (in nm)
        bearing - (in True North)
        Returns:
        double[] array values = [Latitude, Longitude]

        public static double getTackAngle(int windex,
                                  int polars,
                                  java.lang.String tack,
                                  double TackAngle,
                                  double GybeAngle,
                                  double CourseOffset,

        polars -
        tack -
        TackAngle -

        Returns:

      • fft_wind_frequency

        public static void fft_wind_frequency(double sample_rate)
        Method to compute the wind frequency from the data in the LinkList TWD using a Fast Fourier Transformation. This method requires a minimum of MIN_FFT_DATA_POINTS (currently set to 600 = 10 mins)
        Parameters:
        sample_rate - rate at which data points are sampled per second. in our case this is the rate of the screen_updates.

      • getPolars

        public static double[] getPolars(double TWS,
                                 double CourseOffset)
        Compute the Capri 25 polars. See Excel file "Capri25_Polars.xlxs" for the details. Method returns the Target Boat Speed and optimum Tack Angle for each input True Wind Speed (TWS).
        Parameters:
        TWS - True Wind Speed (in kts)
        CourseOffset - 0 = Upwind, 180 = Downwind Course
